result.execSummary:
The defendant DeAngelo L Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Conspiracy to Commit Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<=3g) Second and Subsequent Offense

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 498 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $2,000.00 to be paid to Victim's family as a condition of extended supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign all releases by Agent.

No contact with Victim's family.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant DeAngelo L Campbell in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schubert advises his client wishes to cancel his wish to withdraw his plea.  Defendant wishes to keep his prior plea and go forward with sentencing.  Court advises the parties he is not ready to go forward with sentencing due to the fact that the defendant had wished to withdraw his plea.  Court adjourns this matter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
filed by DeAngelo Campbell. (1-4-16 Legal Clerk contact DOC)

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant DeAngelo L Campbell in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files a second amended information.  Date on the second amended information was amended in Court, initialed by all parties.  Defendant pleads no contest (NOT ALFORD PLEA AS PRIMARILY STATED ON PLEA FORM) to the second amended charge, count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Court orders a PSI be done by 1/13/2016.  Attorney Schubert moves to have the PSI done without recommendation.  Court approves.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant DeAngelo L Campbell in court, in custody, with attorney Michael F Torphy.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Torphy appearing specially as to he has no retainer agreement.  Court finds Atty. Trophy to be the attorney for the defendant.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Dective Aaron Hoppe sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Opper.  Cross examination by Atty. Trophy.  State rests.  Atty. Opper moves for bind over.  Atty. Torphy makes a closing statements.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty. Torphy moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Court declines the motion to modify bail.
